abstract: Study published in journal Auk finds Nazca boobies who are abused as nestlings are more likely to demonstrate aggressive behavior as adults. Study is led by David J Anderson of Wake Forest University.
snippet: Researchers studying Nazca boobies, ground-nesting birds native to the Galápagos Islands, found interesting correlations between early abuse and later behavior.
lead_paragraph: Researchers studying Nazca boobies, ground-nesting birds native to the Galápagos Islands, found interesting correlations between early abuse and later behavior.

headline.main: In Birds, a Possible Clue to the Cycle of Abuse
headline.seo: Study of Nazca Booby Correlates Early Abuse With Later Behavior
headline.print_headline: In Birds, a Possible Clue to the Cycle of Abuse
